last_episode_to_air.name: Dead Drop Danger
last_episode_to_air.overview: Kevin and his team of experts test the laws of gravity in a series of wild, Galileo-inspired experiments.

name: Street Science
overview: Kevin Delaney leaves his lab behind to hit the streets for experiments that are so unusual, offbeat, and so unexpected they will blow your mind.

episodes.name: Big Bam Boom
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts head to the streets to show what it takes to make it snow in Florida and what happens when you combine pressurized liquid nitrogen with thousands of ping pong balls.

episodes.name: Fire Tornado
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts explore the incredible science behind fire, showing how to make it rain fire and how to create a fire tornado.

episodes.name: Flying Saucers
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of science experts use a racecar to put a new twist on an old magic trick and show what it takes to build homemade hovercrafts.

episodes.name: Red Hot Nickel Ball
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts explore the incredible science behind food, showing just how to cook with a red hot nickel ball, and how a bunch of bananas can be transformed into a piano.

episodes.name: Fire Vortex
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of science experts head to the streets to show what it takes to build a vortex cannon that can pump out a ring of fire. Later, they transform everyday objects into explosive fireballs.

episodes.name: Strange Goo
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts explore the strange science behind oobleck, a bizarre material that can behave as both a solid and a liquid.

episodes.name: Curve Your Enthusiasm
episodes.overview: Kevin and his group of experts explore the secret science behind the laws of motion, teaming up with pro athletes to discover how a curveball works and how to make a football do unbelievable things.

episodes.name: No Gravity, No Problem
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts investigate the strange science of invisible forces, revealing how a penny can defy gravity on a hanger, how to painlessly lie on a bed of nails, and other incredible feats you can't normally see with the naked eye.

episodes.name: Fistful of Flames
episodes.overview: Kevin & his team of experts investigate the secret science at work in your kitchen. They show how you can hold fire in the palm of your hand, reveal what it takes to break a wine glass with sound, and discover incredible uses for fire extinguishers.

episodes.name: Rocket Blast
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts explore the amazing science behind rockets, using unconventional materials to power homemade projectiles to incredible heights.

episodes.name: Human Cannonball
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts reveal the secrets of human cannonballs. Later, he uses fire and ice to collapse a giant steel drum and sets a $20 bill on fire without burning it.

episodes.name: Fireball Launcher
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts face off in a fireball launcher showdown to test the dangerous and awesome properties of fire. They also show how to make fireworks with ordinary candy and light up the night with everyday ingredients.

episodes.name: Tension Demolition
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts build a supersized mousetrap capable of destroying everything in its path. They'll also investigate whether the monster mousetrap can generate enough energy to power a car.

episodes.name: Homemade Lightning
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts create homemade lightning bolts and build replica lightsabers using a giant Tesla coil. Then, they use everyday items to make a big explosion.

episodes.name: Forces of Nature
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts use the incredible power of magnetic forces to crush objects and perform amazing feats of levitation.

episodes.name: Superpowered Glue
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts reveal the magic of one of the strongest glues on earth. They find out if just a few drops can keep a bungee jumper safe, and if it can lift thousands of pounds.

episodes.name: Fire Sword
episodes.overview: Kevin Delaney and his team of experts build a flaming sword and use it to destroy everything in its path.

episodes.name: The Invincible Fire
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team use the hottest man-made substance on earth to build a fire that can't be stopped. They'll put this strange material to the test to see if it can really burn through anything, including armor-grade steel.

episodes.name: Hollywood Explosions
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team investigate the explosive power of gasoline. Using cutting-edge science experiments, they find if a tank of gas really explodes like it does in the movies and what it takes to make a Hollywood-style fireball.

episodes.name: Masters of Fire
episodes.overview: Kevin and team take on the ultimate fire challenge. Using cutting-edge experiments, they investigate how a person can eat fire, walk on fire, and be set on fire. They'll also show how everyday ingredients can make a big boom.

episodes.name: Monster Water Gun
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts try to build the world's largest and most powerful water gun and test it to see if the mega weapon has the muscle to shoot through concrete.

episodes.name: Dueling Infernos
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts investigate how a basic backyard grill can make a huge explosion. Using cutting-edge science experiments, they test which gases make the biggest inferno.

episodes.name: Car Chaos
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts use cutting-edge experiments to investigate the hidden dangers of a car crash, and if everyday objects can stop an arrow fired from a high-powered crossbow.

episodes.name: Dead Drop Danger
episodes.overview: Kevin and his team of experts test the laws of gravity in a series of wild, Galileo-inspired experiments.
